  • Constructor Details

    • ImageStore

      public ImageStore()
      Constructs a new ImageStore instance, initializing various game-related images and resources needed for the labyrinth game. This constructor loads images for tiles, cards, treasures, playing pieces, player icons, and the background for the player's hand area. An instance of the Screen class is also initialized to manage screen resources, handling any potential IOExceptions that occur during the loading of screen images.

  • Method Details

    • getCardWithTreasure

      public BufferedImage getCardWithTreasure(int index, boolean isOpen)
      Retrieves the image of a card with an optional treasure overlay.
      Parameters:
      index - : index of the card (0 to 23). An index of 24 refers to the back of the card if it is not open
      isOpen - : boolean indicating whether the card is open (true) or closed (false)
      Returns:
      A BufferedImage of the card with the treasure if open; otherwise, the back of the card
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is invalid (not between 0 and 23)

    • getTileImage

      public BufferedImage getTileImage(int index, int orientation, boolean withTreasure, int treasureIndex) throws IOException
      Retrieves a tile image based on specified parameters including index, orientation, and whether a treasure is to be included.
      Parameters:
      index - : index of the tile, must be within the range of available tiles
      orientation - : orientation of the tile, where 0 is no rotation, 1 is 90 degrees clockwise, 2 is 180 degrees, and 3 is 270 degrees counter-clockwise
      withTreasure - : boolean flag indicating whether to overlay a treasure image on the tile
      treasureIndex - : index of the treasure image to overlay if withTreasure is true
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the requested tile, optionally with a treasure and applied orientation
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error in loading the images
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tile index is invalid

    • getPieceImage

      public BufferedImage getPieceImage(int index)
      Retrieves the image of a playing piece based on the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - : index of the playing piece image to retrieve, where each piece corresponds to a predefined index within the range of available piece images
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the playing piece at the specified index

    • get_handBackground

      public BufferedImage get_handBackground()
      Retrieves the background image for the player's hand area.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the background of the player's hand area.

    • getPlayerIcons

      public BufferedImage getPlayerIcons(int index)
      Retrieves the image icon for a player based on the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - : index of the player icon to retrieve, where each player corresponds to a predefined index within the range of available player icons
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the player icon at the specified index, or null if the index is out of bounds

    • getGameBoardBackground

      public BufferedImage getGameBoardBackground()
      Retrieves the background image of the game board.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the background of the game board.

    • getCardBackImage

      public BufferedImage getCardBackImage()
      Retrieves the image used as the back of a card. Attempts to load an image from a specific file path representing the back of a card used in the game. Returns the card back image if successfully loaded; otherwise, returns null if an IOException occurs.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the card back image, or null if an error occurs during loading

    • getCardImage

      public BufferedImage getCardImage(Card card)
      Retrieves the image of the specified card.
      Parameters:
      card - : Card object for which the image is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the card's image, or null if the image cannot be loaded
